pullRequest.body:
A function on a product space is separately monotone if and only if it is jointly monotone.

Similarly for antitone functions.

Inspired by #15412

---

```suggestion
    (âˆ€ a, Monotone (h âˆ˜ Prod.mk a)) âˆ§ (âˆ€ b, Monotone (fun a => h (a, b))) â†” Monotone h :=
```

```suggestion
    (âˆ€ a, Antitone (h âˆ˜ Prod.mk a)) âˆ§ (âˆ€ b, Antitone (fun a => h (a, b))) â†” Antitone h :=
```

I think this will be more readable with
```lean4
... where
  mp âŸ¨hâ‚‚, hâ‚âŸ© _ _ hab := ...
  mpr h := ...
```
and also below
Done, thanks.

In my opinion, this is more readable if both versions are written similarly, ie
`(âˆ€ a, Monotone (fun b => h (a, b))) âˆ§ (âˆ€ b, Monotone (fun a => h (a, b))) â†” Monotone h`
(and similarly below)
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
lemma monotone_prod_iff {h : Î± Ã— Î² â†’ Î³} :
```
I'd guess this makes a bit more sense in the reverse direction, that is giving a simpler way of proving a function from a product is monotone by showing certain restrictions of it are monotone
Done.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/Monotone/Basic): Separately monotone iff jointly monotone

source.title: feature(Order/ScottContinuity): Scott Continuity on product spaces
